page.title: 19 CUT BACKS IN POST OFFICE.
page.content: About 20 years ago at the Post Office Headquarters it was decided to close 1,000 Post offices by 1987. Two years ago the sub post offices at Windmill Ave and London Rd. were told they might have to close down. People sent petitions to Headquarters and wrote to the newspapers protesting against the closure. They liked their local Post Office and didnt want to travel further for things like stamps, family allowances and old age pensions. Because of the locals' pressure it was decided to keep Windmill Ave. P.O. open.It is a small but busy Post Office,employing 2 people and dealing with 250 F.A. and 250 O.A.P weekly. The protest are still going on against the London Rd closure. It gives out 750 O.A.P.and 250 F.A. weekly and employs 3 people.
